lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Duke is an automated chat-bot which can help you manage your tasks.
* @param filePath String representing the file path of a save file.
* DukeException represents the possible exceptions that might occur while using Duke.
* Returns the string representation of this exception.
* A parser class which parses the user input to make it understandable to the duke program.
* A static method which parses the user input and returns a command based on the input.
* @return Command based on the user input.
* @throws DukeException Errors in the user input.
public static Command parse(String input) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Missing parameters (require Integer) for the command!");
throw new DukeException("Invalid parameters (require Integer) for the command!");

public static String getDescription(String[] inputs, String escape) {

public static LocalDate getTime(String[] inputs, String escape) {
throw new DukeException("Dates cannot be empty!");

* @return Task based on the file line.

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks this task as not done.

return new String[] {"Nice! I've marked this task as done:",

return new String[] {"OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:",

return new String[] {"Noted. I've removed this task:",

String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", this.tasks.size())};

return new String[] {"Here are the matching tasks in your list:",
